Tony Conigliaro, who died of pneumonia and kidney failure Saturday eight years after suffering a near-fatal heart attack that had left him an invalid, was remembered here today as a local boy who played the outfield and was a home run hitter for the Boston Red Sox.

About 300 people attended the service at St. Anthony's Church, where Conigliaro was baptized 45 years ago. The mourners included Conigliaro's mother, Teresa; his brothers, Billy and Richie; his former teammates Dick Radatz, Mike Andrews and Jerry Moses; Johnny Pesky, Conigliaro's first manager with the Red Sox; the current Boston manager, Joe Morgan, and John Volpe, former Governor of Massachusetts. The pallbearers included two former teammates, Rico Petrocelli and Luis Tiant.
